As an AI language model, I am not capable of visiting galleries and architectural landmarks. However, I can provide you some information on some art galleries and architectural landmarks in Berlin that you might find interesting if you plan to visit the city.

In terms of art galleries, Berlin has a vast number of galleries to choose from that exhibit a wide range of contemporary art styles. Some notable galleries include the Martin-Gropius-Bau, the Museum Island, KW Institute for Contemporary Art, the Berlinische Galerie, and the C/O Berlin Foundation.

Architectural landmarks in Berlin include the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag Building, the Berlin Wall Memorial, the Berlin Cathedral, and the Pergamon Museum.

The Brandenburg Gate is one of the most recognized landmarks in Germany and is a symbol of unity of the country. The Reichstag Building is the seat of the German parliament and was reconstructed after the fall of the Berlin Wall with a modern glass dome on top. The Berlin Wall Memorial is a highly symbolic site commemorating the division of Berlin during the Cold War, while the Berlin Cathedral is a stunning Baroque-style building that dominates the city's skyline. Finally, the Pergamon Museum features ancient artefacts from the Middle East, including the famous Ishtar Gate of Babylon.

These are just some examples of the many art galleries and architectural landmarks that Berlin has to offer.
